lexUnit.name: sip.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: Drink (something) by taking small mouthfuls. "I sat sipping coffee."

sentence.text: We sipped our drinks quietly .
He sipped his drink .
He sipped the bitter-sweet drink .
Maxham sipped his drink and smacked his lips appreciatively .
Stok sipped his drink and waited as though he expected a round of applause .
Lee sipped his tea from a cup of pale fragile china and shook his head .
Sipping her milky coffee from a thick cup , she resolved to find out .
She sipped some lukewarm coffee from her cracked mug .
Christina 's hand shook as she sipped golden rum from the bottle and passed it to Stephen .

Others sip nectar during their brief lives to renew their energies and to provide sustenance for egg production , but none need to feed in order to build their bodies ; their growth has come to an end .
Ruth continued to sip her soup in silence .
Only once since that evening have I seen a more beautiful woman , a quiet girl sipping coffee in a tawdry dump misnamed The Lollipop .
She sipped it through a straw looking around with interest .
They lay on deckbeds on the main deck sipping champagne under the blue awning .
Back at Turnhouse , after a light lunch , Carrington and Benson sipped beer .
As Joseph sipped his champagne , Tran Van Hieu appeared silently beside his mother with a younger Annamese man and bowed gravely .
They sat at the kitchen table sipping tea , waiting .
Adam sipped his wine .
SITTING in the bar sipping a breakfast-time brandy and coffee , TV chef Keith Floyd yesterday sadly declared his third marriage was over .
Kate sipped the liquid and felt the burn as it hit her throat .
She sipped some of the cocoa Mrs Blakey had made for her .
These visions would appear , unsummoned , while she sipped cups of strong tea in clients ' bedsitters …
I sip from the cup that she made for me .
He sipped from the first glass .
He had opened a bottle of wine , and Alyssia sipped cautiously from the glass , not wanting to lose control again because she was tipsy .
Sir Brian sipped from the goblet and smiled .
` As you say , Sean , " said Michael , sipping happily on a full beer .
Instead she sipped on several cups of reviving , strong black coffee , and chewed listlessly on a piece of cardboard masquerading as toast .
He sipped at the expensive champagne and wished it had been brandy .
As he sipped at his coffee he perused the extraordinary news sheet .
He sipped slowly at a cup of watered wine and decided to return to his church .
She sipped at the froth , then sat looking towards the fire .
She sipped at a glass of water , wishing she knew why she was so very afraid .
They sipped at the sherry and Meredith presented the hand-embroidered handkerchiefs which were well .
Back in bed she sipped morosely at the whisky , grimacing slightly at its taste , then giggling wryly at her own reaction .
Jotan sipped at his wine , and then set his cup in a niche in the wall beside the fireplace .
Dauntless declined the offer of liquor , and sipped with evident distaste at the tisane .
The pick-up truck being screeched round the corner by a masterful hero , the soft drink sipped by the teenage lead actress -- both products paid good money to be there .
Tug lowered his head and sipped .
He lifted his bowl and sipped , thinking back to earlier that afternoon .
Unconvinced , Hyacinth sipped cautiously , then gagged , seized the enamel bowl from her sister and spat into it .
Jane thanked him and sipped gratefully .
This she sipped slowly , very conscious of the picture she made in her cream linen dress , her pale hair slightly but attractively disordered , Roman sandal thongs binding her long legs to the knee .
He gave her a suspicious look , then as he sipped and tasted the whisky , his face broke into a smile .
She sipped and swallowed , trying to keep her mind blank as the coffee curled , hot and strong , in her stomach .
